chapter.title: Inquiry Module
chapter.para: This menu item provides easy access in an inquiry mode to the complete set of your customers' transactions in all modules of .

The features are organized in much the same way as the inquiry functions provided to customers of the bank and described in the Client User Manual. All the products and all the events of their life cycle can be inquired through this module.

section.title: Functions
section.para: In this module you can do the following:

listitem.para: Display a list of loans requested by the customer.
Display a list of all client requests that are awaiting attention, and view their histories.
Display a list of client requests that your bank has rejected.

section.para: Other functions on this Trade Administration menu are described in other modules in this book.

section.title: Facility Inquiry
section.para: To navigate to the Bank Invoice Inquiry function, from the tool bar, select Middle > Inquiry. Then select Facility Inquiry from the left side navigation menu.

To use this function, click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are Deal, Facility, Borrower Reference, Ccy and Status fields. The list is not displayed until “search criteria” has been entered and the Search button has been clicked. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

section.title: Fee
section.para: You can click on the icon "Click Here" to see a pop up window which displays a section called Facility Details and a sub-section called Fee type. The Facility details will provide you some information about the facility such as the Deal, Facility, Currency, Facility Expire Date and Facility Maturity Date.
The columns in the list of Fees Details are the following

entry.para: The type of fees for the loan.

row.entry: The currency used by the facility.

row.entry: The total fees accrued till date.

section.para: You can also click on the type of fee which will generate another pop-up window that describes the fee selected. You will be able to view:

row.entry: End of date of the fees.

section.title: Sublimits
section.para: You can click on the icon "Click Here" under sublimit column to view the sublimit of one facility. This hyperlink will appear only for the facilities that have sublimit.
Once clicked, a pop up window will display the sublimit details
The Facility details will provide you some information about the facility such as the Deal, Facility, Currency, Facility Expire Date Facility Maturity Date and Borrower Limit.
It exists three (3) types of limits Sublimit (general limit decided by the bank), Risk limit (risk limit decided by the bank) and the Currency limit (currency limit decided by the bank).

para.note: All those limits are expendable and collapsible.

section.para: The columns in the list of Limits are the following

row.entry: The type of the sublimit.
The amount decided by the bank to be the limit.
The currency of the limited amount.

section.title: Outstanding
section.para: Display a list of existing records.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of existing records.
You can search the list by entering search criteria in the System Id, Bank Reference, Company (that sent the request), and/or Product field. (The product can be any product in .)
The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
There is also an Output Format field where you select whether to output the list to the screen ot a CSV file. The default name of the CSV file created is inquiry.xxx.
The columns returned in the list of Existing Records are the following:

entry.para: Unique reference number generated by for this transaction, when it was initiated.
Reference that was assigned by your bank's back office to this transaction.
Abbreviated name of the company that initiated the transaction.
Master amount of the transaction record (not necessarily the same as the current outstanding amount).
Date the record was created. This is the issue date of the product.
Current status of the transaction. The possible values are the following:

listitem.para: New indicates the state of any product right after its successful initiation,
Amended is typically the state of a Letter of Credit or a Banker's Guarantee after an amendment has been applied,
Updated is the generic state generally given by the bank as a follow-up to a free format message transaction initiated by the customer.

Other statuses are available on the bank side and can be used by the Trade Services team when generating a reporting message. The relevant chapters provide further details on these custom product status codes. Hence the state of a transaction record could also be Accepted, Settled, Cancelled, Extended or Purged.

section.para: Each record is shown with two action icons:

entry.para: Open a popup window displaying the current master details of the record.

(History)Display a list of all events for the record, detailing the complete history of the file. For each event in the life of the file, the list shows the Release Date (date on which the related event was sent to the bank, or the date it was by the bank if the latter is undefined as typically for a bank message), the Type of event, the Status of acknowledgement as replied by the bank, the Currency and transaction Amount (for example, the total LC amount for an initiation, the increase for an amendment, and so on), and the identities of the input and supervising users. Clicking on the date displays full details of the transaction.

section.para: On the History page, you can click in the Release Date column to open a popup window showing full details of each event. Within the popup, the Event Details section shows the key details of the event. It shows any additional instructions and attachment provided by the customer as well as the bank's comment and attachments given as part of the reporting.
Here are some examples covering various types of transaction:

listitem.para: For an issuance, a summary of details of the new record, such as the system and reference numbers, the amount and dates will be shown. The system also displays the full set of data submitted by the customer to initiate that file.
For an amendment, only the structured information related to the amendment itself is shown, such as the increase of amount, a new expiry date or tolerance.
For a reporting message from the bank to a client, only a reminder of the product code and the type of transaction (Reporting) are displayed together with the instructions and comment text fields.

section.para: When the Event Details header in the popup window shows a Release Date/Time, it refers to the timestamp of the release of the validated transaction event by the customer to the bank (in the time zone of that customer).
Together with the Bank Message header, the Date/Time field refers to the timestamp of the submission of the reporting message by the bank to the customer (seen from the time zone of the bank).

You can also export the history report as an external file in CSV format, by choosing CSV in the Output Format list box and clicking the icon
. The name of the file downloaded is the System Id of the transaction together with a .csv extension - for example, if an Import Letter of Credit has the system identifier LC0110001008., the filename is LC0110001008.csv.

section.title: Rejected
section.para: Display a list of client requests that your bank has rejected.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of client requests that your bank has rejected.
You can search the list by entering search criteria in the System Id, Company (that sent the request), and/or Product field. (The product can be any product in .)
The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
There is also an Output Format field where you select whether to output the list to the screen ot a CSV file. The default name of the CSV file created is inquiry.xxx.
The columns returned in the list of rejected requests are the following:

entry.para: Unique reference number generated by for this transaction, when it was initiated.
Abbreviated name of the company that initiated the transaction.
Master amount of the transaction record.
Date when the record was rejected.

section.para: Each record is shown with one action icon:

entry.para: (History)Display a list of all events for the record, detailing the complete history of the file. For each event in the life of the file, the list shows the Release Date (date on which the related event was sent to the bank, or the date it was by the bank if the latter is undefined as typically for a bank message), the Type of event, the Status of acknowledgement as replied by the bank, the Currency and transaction Amount (for example, the total LC amount for an initiation, the increase for an amendment, and so on), and the identities of the input, supervising and release users. Clicking on the date displays full details of the transaction.
